alert.note: Alert for Addison; Chittenden (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 13 at 4:56PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Addison and Chittenden Counties in Vermont * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 455 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Essex Junction, South Burlington, St. George, Williston, Hinesburg, Essex Junction Village, Richmond, Shelburne, Monkton Ridge, Essex, Charlotte, Mt. Philo State Park, Monkton, Jericho Village, Jericho, Huntington, Starksboro, Ferrisburgh, Underhill and North Williston. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Minor, poor drainage flooding of streets, underpasses, and low-lying areas is expected. Some basement flooding is also possible. If encountering high water in a vehicle, turn around to avoid becoming stalled.
